intro: Burckella ovalifolia, commonly known as the oval-leaf burckella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven oval-shaped lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers are typically pink or red, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Burckella ovalifolia is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and desert habitats.
